selection_reasoning: I am carrying forward the current champion (trial_5_2) and two strong alternative strategies (6_4 and 5_6). The failures in Gen 6 were largely due to implementation errors (syntax) and over-aggressive parameter tuning. The next generation will focus on 'Clean Refinement'—fixing the syntax in the intensive search logic and cautiously increasing search depth while maintaining the valid constraint set of 5_2.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest score (2.6330). The Sobol-initialization + Basin Hopping framework remains the most robust and high-performing approach. Gen 6 attempts failed to improve it, likely due to syntax errors (e.g., trial_6_2 had a bracket typo) or over-aggressive parameter changes.

Best score for the 'Shrinking Boundaries' approach (2.616). It successfully integrated Basin Hopping as a post-processing step, showing that this hybrid heuristic is competitive and provides important diversity.
Solid multi-start performance (2.6108). It provides a robust alternative to the single long run of 5_2 and is less prone to the 'INVALID' failures seen in the more complex Gen 6 attempts.
